content:
I apologize for any confusion, The wines I previously recommended, Sancerre "Les Monts Damnes" Domaine Vacheron, Pouilly-Fumé "Les Petits Champs" Domaine Didier Dagueneau, Quincy "Les Collines" Domaine Christian Venier, Menetou-Salon "Les Chatelains" Domaine de la Taille aux Loups, Touraine "Les Champs Clos" Domaine des Aubuisières, are considered as premium wines and may not be priced under 150,000 won.

I understand that budget is an important consideration, and I apologize for not taking that into account earlier.

Given that you are looking for a white wine that pairs well with Grüner Veltliner Schloss Gobelsberg Ram and the blue egg dish and is under 150,000 won, I would recommend you to look for Sauvignon Blanc from the Loire Valley, France, Pinot Grigio from Veneto, Italy, Verdejo from Rueda, Spain, Albarino from Rias Baixas, Spain, and Sauvignon Blanc from Marlborough, New Zealand, which I previously recommended, these are the wines that will fit your budget and will provide a good pairing with the dish you are serving.
